block.p: Page Ware Travelstead, the daughter of Brooke and Malcolm Travelstead of Climax, N.Y., was married there last evening to Joshua Blackmer Keay, the son of Marcia P. Keay and David B. Keay of Cape Coral, Fla. Robert Aberlin, a minister affiliated with the Rose Ministries, officiated at Bluestone Farm, the bride's family home.

The bride, 28, is keeping her name. She is a residential project manager, in Brooklyn, at Forest City Ratner Companies, the real estate developer. She graduated from Stanford and received a master's degree in real estate development from Columbia.

Page Ware Travelstead, the daughter of Brooke and Malcolm Travelstead of Climax, N.Y., was married there last evening to Joshua Blackmer Keay, the son of Marcia P. Keay and David B. Keay of Cape Coral, Fla. Robert Aberlin, a minister affiliated with the Rose Ministries, officiated at Bluestone Farm, the brideâ€™s family home.

Page Ware Travelstead, the daughter of Brooke and Malcolm Travelstead of Climax, N.Y., was married there last evening to Joshua Blackmer Keay, the son of Marcia P. Keay and David B. Keay of Cape Coral, Fla. Robert Aberlin, a minister affiliated with the Rose Ministries, officiated at Bluestone Farm, the bride's family home.

The bride, 28, is keeping her name. She is a residential project manager, in Brooklyn, at Forest City Ratner Companies, the real estate developer. She graduated from Stanford and received a master's degree in real estate development from Columbia.

Her father retired as a senior vice president of Atlantic Trust in Manhattan, where he specialized in international banking. He is now the director of finance for the Millbrook School of Millbrook, N.Y. He serves on the board of Poly Prep Country Day School in Brooklyn. Her mother is an interior designer.

The bridegroom, 33, an architect, works at daSilva Architects in Manhattan. He graduated from Roger Williams. His father retired as the New England territory manager for the Crescent Cardboard Company of Wheeling, Ill.
